summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan scheduling and detailing the logistics for Ghislaine Maxwell's arraignment on the S2 Superseding Indictment. It outlines COVID-19 protocols, public access via video feed and teleconference, and requires the government and defense to notify the court if victims or family members wish to attend.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant scheduled for arraignment on the S2 Superseding Indictment in this criminal case.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge issuing the order scheduling the arraignment and setting forth the logistical and public access details for the proceeding.

events.title: Arraignment on S2 Superseding Indictment
events.description: Scheduled arraignment proceeding for Ghislaine Maxwell at 2:30 p.m. in Courtroom 24B of the Daniel Patrick Moynihan Courthouse.

events.title: Deadline for Victim and Family Attendance Notification
events.description: Deadline for the Government and defense counsel to inform the Court whether any alleged victims or the defendant's family members wish to attend the arraignment.

locations: Daniel Patrick Moynihan Courthouse, 500 Pearl Street, New York, NY
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's arraignment on a superseding indictment (S2) was scheduled for April 23, 2021.
The court order emphasizes victim rights under 18 U.S.C. ยง 3771, requiring the government to notify victims of the proceeding.
Due to COVID-19, strict entry protocols were in place, including a health questionnaire, temperature check, and specific mask requirements.
Public access was expanded through an in-person video feed in overflow courtrooms and a public teleconference line for audio.
The order mandates that both the prosecution and defense notify the court by April 21, 2021, if victims or family members plan to attend.
